• Improve quality of the line by ensuring technology requirements are met.

• , 4+ years of relevant biotechnology or pharmaceutical industry experience.
• Experience in a process or product development role, especially technology transfer to manufacturing and/or QC groups.
• Proficient in standard molecular biology techniques such as sample preparation, nucleic acid amplification and purification (RNA/DNA), and DNA/RNA in situ hybridization experience.
• Light and fluorescent microscopy experience.
• Experience with experimental design and statistical data analysis.
• Experience troubleshooting molecular biology-based assays and issues with reagent quality (manufacturing process, QC and stability).
• Experience generating reports/presentations and forecasting reagent usage and costs.
• Strong collaboration and communication skills.

• Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field anticipated to graduate in May 2027.
• Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.
• Experience with PySpark/Spark is a plus.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills.
• Hands-on experience with real alternative datasets and AI tools used in financial research.
• Experience with LLM orchestration frameworks like LangChain or LangGraph.
• Prior experience in data testing, anomaly detection, or production-quality code.
• Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Databricks) and distributed data processing.

job_title: Data Scientist - AI / Machine Learning / Python / Weather Prediction
job_description:
• Proven experience in a technical role using AI/ML for geophysical prediction (especially weather).
• Experience running, validating, and fine-tuning AI/ML and foundation models.
• Ability to adapt open-source software for business needs.
• PhD in a relevant geophysical field (or equivalent experience).
• Experience training AI/ML models from scratch.
• Background in satellite data analysis or signal processing (GNSS/radar).
• Deep knowledge of both data science and a geophysical science (meteorology is a plus).
• Proficiency in Python (or similar) in a Linux environment.

• 2+ years of professional or academic experience working with data pipelines, analysis, or dashboardsProficiency in Python and SQLExperience using Databricks, Power BI, or similar tools for data modeling and visualizationExcellent communication and organizational skills to support client meetings and deliverables, and explain technical concepts/solutions to non-technical stakeholdersEffective time management and ability to adapt to changing prioritiesExperience with large scale data analytics frameworks such as Apache SparkExperience working with Azure Databricks and one or more Azure specialty certifications (SysOps Administrator, Security, Advanced Networking, DevOps Engineer, Administration, Architecture)Proficiency in working with tools such as Docker and KubernetesProficiency with cloud networking (DNS, TCP, Firewalls, Proxy Servers, Load Balancing, VPN, and VPC), storage, security, and computeExperience working with and supporting Agile development teams.

• Ability to learn quickly, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the cloud/IT technology space.
